article: Comedian Groucho Mark said, "Those are my principles. If you don't like them, I have others." You and I have principles and we also have _ . I have opinions about what I think is right or wrong or good or bad. But they're only opinions --I could be _ ! I won't try to build my life around my opinions, _ I'll try to keep to my principles. A 15-year-old boy learned a valuable _ about life principles. One day, he found a wallet that _ $127 as well as a woman's _ . He jumped onto his _ and went to her house. He told her he found her wallet and she gave him a big _ . She also gave him twenty dollars. That evening the boy told his parents about the _ and his father said, "I don't think you should have _ $20 for doing what you should have done. A person shouldn't be rewarded for being _ ." He considered his father's statement and _ that he would return the money. He _ biked to the lady's home and gave her back the money. She didn't want to _ it, but he told her she had to -- that his father pointed out something to him that he had _ realized before. When ideals such as honesty and a personal standard of always doing the right thing guide our every action and decision, we _ develop a good character. These great principles _ our lives and make us into a person of _ . They teach confidence. That boy is _ to be raised by a wise father who had the wisdom to say, "Those are my principles."
